title: While doubling India headcount, Salesforce also facilitated 65,000 internships: Arundhati Bhattacharya
description: Bhattacharya said, “We have an MOU (memorandum of understanding) with AICTE for providing 200,000 internships, of which we have already done 65,000. So these internships are for three months - one and a half months virtual, one and a half months on the ground, in location.”
content: US based software vendor Salesforce doubled its India headcount in the country in the last few years, said Arundhati Bhattacharya, Chairperson and CEO of Salesforce India on the sidelines of the firm’s annual conference, Dreamforce 2024 in San Francisco.Speaking to Indian media, Bhattacharya said, “We have an MOU (memorandum of understanding) with AICTE for providing 200,000 internships, of which we have already done 65,000. So these internships are for three months - one and a half months virtual, one and a half months on the ground, in location.”Speaking about leadership and talents in India, she added “Now, we hire a lot of senior leaders out of India as well. So, they sit out of India and manage teams (globally) also. So, more than 2x growth in the last two years in the overall staffing …… at this point of time, we're about 13,000 plus.”The world is moving into the Indian era and the country presents exciting opportunities, Marc Benioff, chief executive of cloud-based software company Salesforce has said a day earlier.“There is no question that we are going to move into an incredible moment in India. And you know it’s a very exciting opportunity, we have invested very aggressively in India,” Benioff said.
